part.title: Leasehold properties
part.para: [COMPLETE IN RESPECT OF EACH OF THE PROPERTIES TO WHICH TITLE IS LEASEHOLD]

entry.para: [DESCRIPTION BY REFERENCE TO TITLE NUMBER OR CONVEYANCE UNDER WHICH TITLE IS HELD]

para.emphasis: Deeds and documents to be handed over on the Transfer Date

clause.title: Definitions
clause.para: The definitions in this paragraph apply in this Part 3 of Schedule [NUMBER].

def.para: the charges affecting each of the Freehold Properties as identified in Part 1 of Schedule [NUMBER] (Freehold properties).
the conditions in Part 1 of the Standard Commercial Property Conditions (Second Edition) and Standard Condition means any one of them.
the conditions in Part 2 of the Standard Commercial Property Conditions (Second Edition).
the rights benefiting each of the Freehold Properties as identified in Part 1 of Schedule [NUMBER] (Freehold properties).

subclause1.para: The Part 1 Conditions are incorporated in this Part 3 of Schedule [NUMBER] so far as they:

subclause2.para: apply to a sale by private treaty;
relate to freehold land;
are not inconsistent with the other clauses in this agreement or paragraphs in this Part 3 of Schedule [NUMBER]; and
have not been modified or excluded by the other clauses in this agreement or paragraphs in this Part 3 of Schedule [NUMBER].

subclause1.para: The Part 2 Conditions are not incorporated into this Part 3 of Schedule [NUMBER].
The following Standard Conditions shall not apply:

subclause2.para: Standard Condition 1.1.4(a);
Standard Condition 2;
Standard Conditions 3.1, 3.2.1 and 3.3;
Standard Conditions 6.1 to 6.3;
Standard Condition 6.6.2 to 6.6.4;
Standard Conditions 7.1.1 to 7.1.4;
Standard Condition 10; and
Standard Condition 11.

subclause1.para: The Standard Conditions shall be amended as follows:

subclause2.para: the definition of "conveyancer" in Standard Condition 1.1.1(f) shall be construed as referring to the Buyer’s Solicitors and/or the Seller’s Solicitors, as the context requires;
the definition of "completion date" in Standard Condition 1.1.1(d) shall be construed as a reference to the Completion Date; and
[OTHERS].

subclause1.para: The Seller shall sell or procure the sale to the Buyer of each of the Freehold Properties, with the benefit of the Rights.
In respect of each of the Freehold Properties, the Buyer cannot require the Seller to:

subclause2.para: transfer it or any part of it to any person other than the Buyer; or
transfer it in more than one parcel or by more than one transfer; or
apportion the Purchase Price between different parts of it.

subclause1.para: Completion of the sale and purchase of the Freehold Properties shall take place on the Completion Date, and the Seller shall sell or procure the sale of each of the Freehold Properties with vacant possession on that date.
Title to each of the Freehold Properties has been deduced to the Buyer’s Solicitors before the date of this agreement.

The deeds and documents of title for each of the Freehold Properties are listed in Part 1 of Schedule [NUMBER] (Freehold properties) and copies of those documents have been given to the Buyer’s Solicitors.
On the Completion Date, the Seller shall transfer or procure the transfer of each Freehold Property with full title guarantee.
Each of the Freehold Properties is sold free from encumbrances other than:

subclause2.para: any Disclosed matters, except the Charges;
any matters discoverable by inspection of it before the date of this agreement; and
any matters that the Seller does not and could not reasonably know about.

subclause1.para: The transfers of each of the Freehold Properties shall be:

subclause2.para: in the form set out in Part 5 of Schedule [NUMBER] (Transfer of freehold properties); and
prepared and executed in duplicate, the duplicate to be retained by the Seller.

subclause1.para: The definitions in this paragraph apply in this Part 4 of Schedule [NUMBER].

def.para: the charges affecting each of the Leasehold Properties as identified in Part 2 of Schedule [NUMBER] (Leasehold properties).
in respect of each Leasehold Property, the person or persons from time to time entitled to the reversion (whether immediate or not) expectant upon the termination of a Lease.

the consent of the Landlord authorising a transfer or an assignment of the residue of the term of a Leasehold Property to the Buyer in accordance with and pursuant to the terms of the Lease, such consent being evidenced in a written, formal licence to assign, dated and being obtained [on reasonable terms] [free from unreasonable conditions], signed or executed by or on behalf of all of the parties to it.
[[DATE] OR the date being six calendar months less two days from and including the [Completion Date].
the conditions in Part 1 of the Standard Commercial Property Conditions (Second Edition) and Standard Condition means any one of them.
the conditions in Part 2 of the Standard Commercial Property Conditions (Second Edition).
the rights benefiting each of the Leasehold Properties as identified in Part 2 of Schedule [NUMBER] (Leasehold properties).

subclause1.para: The Part 1 Conditions are incorporated in this Part 4 of Schedule [NUMBER] so far as they:

subclause2.para: apply to a sale by private treaty;
are applicable to leasehold land;
are not inconsistent with the other clauses in this agreement or paragraphs in this Part 4 of Schedule [NUMBER]; and
have not been modified by the other clauses in this agreement or paragraphs in this Part 4 of Schedule [NUMBER].

subclause1.para: The Part 2 Conditions are not incorporated into this Part 4 of Schedule [NUMBER].
The following Standard Conditions shall not apply:

subclause2.para: Standard Condition 1.1.4(a);
Standard Condition 2;
Standard Conditions 3.1, 3.2.1 and 3.3;
Standard Conditions 6.1 to 6.3;
Standard Conditions 6.6.2 to 6.6.4;
Standard Conditions 7.1.2 and 7.1.3;
Standard Condition 10.3; and
Standard Condition 11.

subclause1.para: The Standard Conditions shall be amended as follows:

subclause2.para: the definition of "conveyancer" in Standard Condition 1.1.1(f) shall be construed as referring to the Buyer’s Solicitors and/or the Seller’s Solicitors, as the context requires;
the definition of "completion date" in Standard Condition 1.1.1(d) shall be construed as a reference to the Lease Transfer Date; and
[OTHERS].

subclause1.para:
Subject to
paragraph 9
of this Part 4 of Schedule [NUMBER], the Seller shall sell or procure the sale to the Buyer of the Leasehold Properties, with the benefit of the Rights.
In respect of each of the Leasehold Properties, the Buyer cannot require the Seller to:

subclause2.para: transfer or assign it or any part of it to any person other than the Buyer; or
transfer or assign it in more than one parcel or by more than one transfer; or
apportion the Purchase Price between different parts of it.

subclause1.para: Completion of the sale and purchase of each Leasehold Property shall take place on the Lease Transfer Date, and the Seller shall sell or procure the sale of the Leasehold Properties with vacant possession on that date.
Title to each of the Leasehold Properties has been deduced to the Buyer’s Solicitors before the date of this agreement.
The deeds and documents of title for each of the Leasehold Properties are listed in Part 2 of Schedule [NUMBER] (Leasehold properties) and copies have been given to the Buyer’s Solicitors.
On the Lease Transfer Date, the Seller shall transfer or assign, or procure the transfer or assignment of, each of the Leasehold Properties with full title guarantee.
Each of the Leasehold Properties is sold free from encumbrances other than:

subclause2.para: any Disclosed matters, except the Charges;
any matters discoverable by inspection of it before the date of this agreement; and
any matters that the Seller does not and could not reasonably know about.

subclause1.para: The transfers or assignments of the Leasehold Properties shall be:

subclause2.para: in the form set out in Part 6 of Schedule [NUMBER] (Transfer or assignments of leasehold properties); and
prepared and executed in duplicate, the duplicate to be retained by the Seller.

clause.title: Landlord’s consent to a transfer of the leasehold properties

subclause1.para: The provisions of this paragraph 9 of Part 4 of Schedule [NUMBER] apply in respect of each Leasehold Property.
Completion of the transfer or assignment of a Leasehold Property is conditional on every Licence required under the relevant Lease.

[On or before OR Immediately following] the Completion Date, the Seller shall apply for and use all reasonable endeavours to obtain every Licence as required by each Lease. The Seller shall pay all costs associated with obtaining, or seeking to obtain, each Licence.
The Buyer shall, without delay:

subclause2.para: supply all information, accounts and references as the Landlord or the Seller may reasonably require in connection with an application for or consideration of any Licence;

supply, procure or enter into any guarantees, rental or other deposits, direct covenants or other security for the performance of the tenant covenants of the Lease as may be lawfully required under each Lease; and

execute the documents containing a Licence and execute or procure the execution of the documents (if any) required to be entered into pursuant to
paragraph 9.4(c)
, each in the form reasonably required by the Landlord. The Buyer shall return all such documents duly executed to the Seller's Solicitors within [ten] Business Days after each engrossment has been submitted to the Buyer's Solicitors.

subclause1.para: If any Licence required in respect of a Leasehold Property has not been obtained by the Longstop Date, then this agreement shall automatically rescind in relation to that Leasehold Property and the provisions of paragraph 11 of Part 4 of Schedule [NUMBER] (Relocation indemnity) shall apply.
The Buyer shall be entitled to occupy each Leasehold Property as bare licensee only, on a non-exclusive basis, from the Completion Date until the earlier of:

subclause2.para: the Longstop Date; or
the Lease Transfer Date; or
the date upon which this agreement is rescinded in relation to that Leasehold Property.

subclause1.para: Whilst occupying the Leasehold Property as bare licensee, the Buyer shall be responsible for, and shall indemnify the Seller against, all sums payable by the tenant under the Lease, other than the payment of rent.
Whilst occupying the Leasehold Property as bare licensee, the Buyer shall pay to the Seller a licence fee equal to all rents payable by the tenant under the Lease, such licence fee to be paid:

subclause2.para: in respect of rents payable on a specified date in the Lease, [ten] Business Days before the date they fall due for payment under the Lease; and
in respect of rents payable on demand in the Lease, within [five] Business Days of written demand from the Seller.

subclause1.para: Whilst occupying the Leasehold Property as bare licensee, the Buyer covenants with the Seller that it shall observe and perform all the tenant covenants in the Lease (other than the covenants relating to payment of the rents and alienation) and shall indemnify the Seller against all costs, expenses, damages, proceedings and losses suffered or incurred by the Seller arising from any breach, non-observance or non-performance of the tenant covenants in the Lease (other than the covenants relating to payment of the rents and alienation).

This licence to occupy does not create, and is not intended to create, a demise and is personal to the Buyer. This licence cannot be assigned and the Buyer shall not be entitled to share occupation of a Leasehold Property with any other person, nor hold the Leasehold Property on trust for a third party.
Within [five] Business Days after the later of:

subclause2.para: the Buyer vacating the Leasehold Property; and
the date upon which this agreement is rescinded in relation to that Leasehold Property,

subclause1.para: the Seller shall pay to the Buyer:

subclause3.para: That part of the Final Purchase Price apportioned to the relevant Leasehold Property together with interest at the Interest Rate. Such interest shall be calculated from the Completion Date until the date that repayment is actually made; and

On demand and keep the Buyer indemnified against all damages, costs and expenses (including without limitation all costs, expenses and disbursements payable to solicitors, surveyors, engineers and other professional advisors) incurred by the Buyer resulting from its vacation of the Leasehold Property to include without limitation all relocation costs associated with securing an alternative suitable leasehold property similar to the Leasehold Property for the purposes of conducting the Business.

part.title: Transfer and assignments of leasehold properties
